text: We are running a JVM application on a very small machine. I would say that was a normal behaviour. :smile:

elements.text: We are running a JVM application on a very small machine. I would say that was a normal behaviour.

text: On the other hand the CPU spike was odd. If that was something like an application memory overflow the CPU would NOT run on 196%. So something happened there which wasn't an intended use of the application.

elements.text: On the other hand the CPU spike was odd. If that was something like an application memory overflow the CPU would NOT run on 196%. So something happened there which wasn't an intended use of the application.

text:
<@U05FU0HPZ9T> ^^

You can find it on AWS S3.

There is no cronjob just yet, for autofilling it. But the logic is almost there for it. For now, i just deployed this into the cluster, and it will upload the whole month of July, which is anyway enough for our rewards at this point.

text:
That is what I put into the TODO list of canton billing admin:

```- Create a page where the party IDs listed out. GET /parties and a page on the frontend to display them.
- Create a page where the party got displayed by ID. GET /parties/{partyId} and a page on the frontend to display it.
  - All the information about the party should be displayed, like keycloak details, canton details, balance, last transactions, etc.
- On the party details page add a button to delete the party, this should delete everything related to the party, like keycloak user, canton party, etc. DELETE /parties/{partyId}
- Update the metadata of the party, like the name, description, etc. PUT /parties/{partyId}```
The listing as already done and I'm currently working on the party details page. Hopefully I can finish these all on the weekend.

elements.text: That is what I put into the TODO list of canton billing admin:

text:
Sounds prudent! Better to have a disable feature, if anything. Let’s not give too much power to anyone right now. We’re rushing things, better to move carefully.

But even a disable feature… that would mean we would have to build something into  the billing system that checks if disabled.

And actually we can simulate disabled by just moving the money out.

So maybe it’s best to skip disable / delete for now.

elements.text:
Sounds prudent! Better to have a disable feature, if anything. Let’s not give too much power to anyone right now. We’re rushing things, better to move carefully.

But even a disable feature… that would mean we would have to build something into  the billing system that checks if disabled.

And actually we can simulate disabled by just moving the money out.

So maybe it’s best to skip disable / delete for now.
